question: Which of the following statements correctly describe a Dirac (pulse) input in 1D solute transport? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! A Dirac input is instantaneous, all mass is injected at once, and mass conservation holds.
fail: Not quite. A Dirac input is an instantaneous point-source injection; it is not a continuous boundary condition.

question: Which statements about pure advection in a 1D column are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! Pure advection produces a sharp front moving at v, with no spreading.
fail: Review pure advection: it has a sharp front that moves at v without spreading.

question: Which statements about dispersion in groundwater flow are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! Dispersion spreads the plume and depends on flow velocity.
fail: Check the definition of mechanical dispersion and its link to flow velocity.

question: Which statements about breakthrough curves (BTCs) are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! BTCs show concentration vs. time at a location and are strongly influenced by dispersion.
fail: Remember: a BTC is concentration versus time at a fixed point.

question: Which statements about concentration profiles are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! Concentration profiles describe solute distribution in space at one moment in time.
fail: Review the distinction between Dirac input and continuous injection profiles.

question: Which statements about transport parameters and definitions are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: Correct! v = q/n, dispersivity has units of length, and D = α · v.
fail: Check the definitions of v, dispersivity, and the dispersion coefficient.
